# Tips

## Writing up

* Start writing early

* It doesn't have to be perfect

* It's easier to edit documents than writing from scratch

## Applying for jobs {auto-animate=true}

* What sort of job do you want to do?

* Where do you find them?

* How do you write a good application?

## Applying for jobs {auto-animate=true}

::: {.nonincremental}
* What sort of job do you want to do?

    * Think about what you want from your job

    * Think about why you want to do your job

* Where do you find them?

    * Talk to supervisors

    * Talk to your peers

* How do you write a good application?

    * Contact the PI

    * Review each other's CVs

    * Check out the STAR method

    * Think about transferable skills
:::

::: {.notes}
* Do you want to work with other people?
* Do you want to work independently?
* Do you want to work on topics related to your PhD?
* Do you want to continue to work with your supervisor?
* Let them know that you are interested in pursuing a postdoc
:::

## Moving on

* Try to avoid overlap of writing up and new job

* Think about how things are changing

* Find a way to process the end of the PhD

* Consider taking a break

* Celebrate
